definition: to flee/to run away
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to go to/to head for/towards
(used in given names)/variant of 奔[ben1]
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to escape/to run away/to flee
to scatter in all directions

sentences.english: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 你们要奔逃，自救性命，独自居住，好像旷野的杜松。

sentences.english: As Michael flees in the woods, Ferguson spots him.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔奔逃出森林，费格斯看见了他。

sentences.english: They scattered, leaving behind bloodstains and missing shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他们四散奔逃，只留下血迹和掉下的鞋子。

sentences.english: Many servants are breaking away from their masters these days.
sentences.chinese: 近来忤逆主人奔逃的仆人甚多。

sentences.english: In his dream, the chef takes the case and runs west.
sentences.chinese: 在梦里，厨师拿着包向西奔逃而去。

sentences.english: They rush through our minds like stampeding cattle or sheep.
sentences.chinese: 有时，思想在我们的头脑里会像受惊的牛羊四处奔逃。

sentences.english: A group of zebras started up by a shot.
sentences.chinese: 一声枪响把一群斑马惊得四散奔逃。

sentences.english: Terrified animals flee before the onslaught.
sentences.chinese: 森林中的动物惊恐的四散奔逃。

sentences.english: The rioters dispersed only after military tanks rumbled through the street.
sentences.chinese: 只有当坦克驶入街道后暴民才四散奔逃。

sentences.english: Kill temple street a 15-second, mass run off in different directions.
sentences.chinese: 杀庙街头一场恶战，大众四散奔逃。

sentences.english: It should be done smoothly, without panicking the sheep and causing them to scatter or run.
sentences.chinese: 这个经过应当很安稳，不应使羊群感到惊惧而散奔逃。

definition: to scatter in all directions
to run away/to flee in disarray
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
in a panic/flurried
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
to escape/to disappear
to run away to/to flee
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to charge
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
defeated troops/routed army/scattered soldiers
to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
